snippet: The electronics retailer said factors that buoyed end-of-year results were unlikely to endure, and its stock dropped sharply.
abstract: Best Buy reports holiday season sales grew by 2.6 percent, to $11.37 billion from $11.13 billion in year-earlier period; attributes growth to brisk sales of flat-screen TVs and smartphones, but expects that demand for electronics will decline in new year.
lead_paragraph: The electronics retailer said factors that buoyed end-of-year results were unlikely to endure, and its stock dropped sharply.

headline.main: Best Buy Outlook Overshadows Holiday Sales Gains
headline.print_headline: Best Buy Holiday Sales Increase 2.6% in U.S.
